update.description:
4 new tutorials:
* installation
* pu/sub
* camera images
* model sdf information

Notes:
  The images won't show up before the PR is merged.
  The gazebojs source code is in the gazebojs  repo.
  I'd like to make sure that setup is robust, so please document any problems / workaround.
update.title: GazeboJs : NodeJs bindings for Gazebo

content.raw: I'm getting the same errors. Could we possibly add a note to the tutorial alerting the user that these are known issues so they don't think it's only with them?
content.html: I'm getting the same errors. Could we possibly add a note to the tutorial alerting the user that these are known issues so they don't think it's only with them?

content.raw: Here as well, add a link to `publish.js`? (So the user can simply right-click, save as. This is how it's done in the DRCSim tutorials, [for example](http://gazebosim.org/tutorials?tut=drcsim_ros_python&cat=drcsim#TheCode).)
content.html: Here as well, add a link to publish.js? (So the user can simply right-click, save as. This is how it's done in the DRCSim tutorials, for example.)

content.raw:
This is a bug in gazebojs:

https://bitbucket.org/osrf/gazebojs/issue/3/segmentation-fault-during-unsubscribe

Should be fixed in its own gazebojs PR.
content.html:
This is a bug in gazebojs:

https://bitbucket.org/osrf/gazebojs/issue/3/segmentation-fault-during-unsubscribe

Should be fixed in its own gazebojs PR.

content.raw:
I tried the tutorial again and I see two main problems:

* In the GazeboJS camera topic tutorial, after saving the images I got:

```
#!python
node: /usr/include/boost/smart_ptr/shared_ptr.hpp:653: typename boost::detail::sp_member_access<T>::type boost::shared_ptr<T>::operator->() const [with T = gazebo::transport::Connection; typename boost::detail::sp_member_access<T>::type = gazebo::transport::Connection*]: Assertion `px != 0' failed.
Aborted (core dumped)
```
* In the pub/sub tutorial, after receiving the five messages I got another segfault:

```
#!python
GZPubSub::Unsubscribe() topic = [~/world_stats]
Segmentation fault (core dumped)
```
content.html:
I tried the tutorial again and I see two main problems:

  • In the GazeboJS camera topic tutorial, after saving the images I got:
node: /usr/include/boost/smart_ptr/shared_ptr.hpp:653: typename boost::detail::sp_member_access<T>::type boost::shared_ptr<T>::operator->() const [with T = gazebo::transport::Connection; typename boost::detail::sp_member_access<T>::type = gazebo::transport::Connection*]: Assertion `px != 0' failed.
Aborted (core dumped)
  • In the pub/sub tutorial, after receiving the five messages I got another segfault:
GZPubSub::Unsubscribe() topic = [~/world_stats]
Segmentation fault (core dumped)

content.raw: extra space between Create and subscribe.js

Avoid references to specific gazebo version here? so it doesn't become outdated when we release new gazebo versions. So, perhaps simply:

`Install gazebo (see http://gazebosim.org/tutorials?tut=install)`
content.html:
Avoid references to specific gazebo version here? so it doesn't become outdated when we release new gazebo versions. So, perhaps simply:

Install gazebo (see http://gazebosim.org/tutorials?tut=install)

content.raw: I'm still having this issue... By the way, the `osrf/gazebojs` repository seems to be read-only, so I don't have access to issues and other things.
